I'm eager to learn more about
CS (Computer Science, not Counter-Strike)
and logic programming in particular.

In the past, I've worked for small-to-medium companies
in the Greater Metropolitan Paris Area ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·
(and also in Stuttgart ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª and Budapest ğŸ‡­ğŸ‡º).

Today, I can provide you with consulting services
as a part-time freelance software developer.

name: Gazouillis sonnant de moins en moins justeâ€¦
summary: â€¦ comme mode de dÃ©ploiement alternatif

content.html:
Going to redeploy my (this) personal website...
I need to allocate more RAM as i'm starting to see starvation coming.

Wish me luck.. Last time I had it re-deployed was last monthğŸ€

The deployment script started around 14h27.

Container build just started ğŸ‹

JavaScript runtime is installed ğŸ’›

PHP extensions are being compiled ğŸ˜

(it seemed to take ages in comparison with the other steps)
there might be room for optimization here
no sure how though ğŸ¤”

Extensions are being configured now.

JavaScript assets have been installed, minified.

Checks, clean up have started

Website is still up but slow ğŸ˜Œ

Okâ€¦ I broke everyting ğŸ˜

The deployment script failed around 15H36 with an unexpected status.

What did go wrong?

Apparently, what I call the web worker (PHP FPM) could start
because of ill-defined owner uid injected with --build-arg options.

At some point, I had the system user uid modified
without double checking there would not be any regression.

@mereteresa's question surprised me and gives me a interesting idea ğŸ’¡

Tu nous le fais en temps rÃ©el ou c'est ton Terminal qui touitte ?

â€” mere-teresa (@mereteresa) September 14, 2022

En rÃ©ponse Ã  cela :

J'ai le terminal en face de moi et je crois que la derniÃ¨re Ã©tape m'a tuer

Mais Ã§a me permet aussi de prototyper ğŸ˜…

La bonne nouvelle c'est que mes autres sites ne sont pas tombÃ©s
alors que le reverse proxy a clairement redÃ©marrÃ©.

Ah ben je m'en suis doutÃ© :P

Un peu plus tard, j'ai compris qu'une modification rÃ©cente de la page d'accueil aurait eu un impact sur le test de vÃ©rification effectuÃ© aprÃ¨s dÃ©ploiement.
Ce dernier Ã©tait en Ã©chec ğŸš¨ mais pour de mauvaises raisons.

C'Ã©tait aussi de cette maniÃ¨re que je me suis embourbÃ© dans mes tentatives de dÃ©ploiement d'un correctif.

D'oÃ¹ l'importance de vÃ©rifier qu'un test rouge avant une modification (dans le cas contraire, on peut se trouver nez Ã  nez ici avec un faux nÃ©gatif).

Why not deploying by tweeting something?
It should be pretty easy to deal with such once the connectors are in placeâ€¦
I'll keep that under wrap for nowâ€¦ Other stuff to take of ğŸ˜…

Tags:

  • #deployment
  • #tweet
    • #ops

name: Notes about words, language, semantics after reading A.

content.html:
I find the diversity of semantic fields the so-called "Spotify model" draws from quite fascinating.
- The military with the 'Squad', a small unit lead by a NCO, which carries images of mud, jungle, blood and sweat, "the smell of the napalm in the morning"...

â€” Arnaud (@dr_c0d3) September 12, 2022

I kind of recall having found those words
rather disturbing the first time
i heard themâ€¦

Reflecting links which are hard to find within companies,
nowadays organizations and also feeling like rewriting meaning on the fly.

Hard to find â¡ Of course, personal feeling
Rewriting meaning â¡ In spite of spoken languages continuous evolution

I voluntarily tried to frame my remarks in a non judgmental way :)

â€” Arnaud (@dr_c0d3) September 12, 2022

Words are sometimes like smoke and mirrors and the absence
of words also speaks volume for themselvesÂ 
There is one size fits all solution. ğŸ¤·ğŸ¼ ğŸ° ğŸ²

Talking out loud or asynchronously
has the benefit of sometimes bringing
some consensus eventually.

This conversation brought memories of a listener,
having curiosity with regard to how words
could be turned into something else entirely.

Hear around 56:55
https://colibris.link/0vqxR

Tags:

  • #framing
  • #language
  • #semantics

et de ses extensions pour @firefox et @ChromiumDevÂ :)

Je crois qu'il y a quelque chose Ã  faire du cÃ´tÃ© de la reco
pour ces parages :)
Un centre d'intÃ©rÃªt pour @SylvaineGÂ et
moi-mÃªme avec @revue_2_presse.
Je serais ravi d'en parler en privÃ© avec @MarcFaddoulÂ 
ou d'autres membres de l'Ã©quipe.

Personne en particulier, seulement les sujets qui ne mâ€™intÃ©ressent pas particuliÃ¨rement.

â€” FrÃ©dÃ©rick Tyteca (@ftyteca) September 10, 2022

Je me suis mal exprimÃ© :)

Je voulais dire : si des recommandations sont insatisfaisantes,
possible que des recommandations alternatives
telles que celles proposÃ©s par l'application
citÃ©e ci-dessus soit d'une utilitÃ©.

En effet, elles amÃ¨nent Ã  des recommandations
en provenance des crÃ©ateurs de contenus.
Le propos Ã©tait en lien avec un problÃ¨me
constatÃ© depuis Youtube,
ce sur quoi j'ai rebondi tandis que concernant Twitter,
il se trouve que je partage ton avis et
refuse quasiment systÃ©matiquement
les recommandations depuis belle lurette.

Comme YouChoose par exemple
permet de se rÃ©approprier des boucles de confiance
de proche en proche quant Ã  des propositions
Ã  niveau qualitÃ©s voisins,
je suis persuadÃ© qu'on pourrait faire des choses similaires
avec Tw et par le jeu des connaissances des producteurs de contenus.

Ces idÃ©es ne sont pas rÃ©centes et
on peut avoir vite fait de tomber
dans les travers du crowdsourcing (de contenus, ou de la Â«curationÂ»)
mais quand ce sont des Â«spÃ©cialistesÂ» de fait
dans des domaines fixes qui auraient la main
pour voter avec pondÃ©ration quant Ã  des recommandationsâ€¦

On pourrait aboutir Ã  une forme de fediverse
sans avoir Ã  quitter les plateformes centralisatrices
(de contenus, de crÃ©ations) via extensions,
de l'analyze en temps rÃ©el des croisillons visibles,
de systÃ¨me Ã  divulgation nulle de connaissanceâ€¦

En lieu et place d'essayer de scinder Ã  tout prix
les modÃ¨les qui marchent,
qui attirent du fait des masses critiques atteintes,
on pourrait imaginer appliquer en surimpression
ses propres filtres lÃ©gers et pour lequels
interviendraient auto-hÃ©bergement et serveurs mandataires.

name: Ship/Show/Ask, a branching strategy - authored by Rouan Wilsenach

content.html:
Tags:

  • #branching
    • #model
  • #ship
    • #show
      • #ask
  • #version
    • #control

In two words: awesome schedule!

In response to announcements
for sessions held at DataEngBytes 2022 this year.

Sapirâ€“Whorf ^1 hypothesis
or something something?

I stumbled upon that principle
thanks to /bblfish and /comsaradufour

So far this iteration has managed to avoid Sapir-Worf. But somehow John Conway has had 3 mentions so far.

â€” Chewxy (@chewxy) September 9, 2022

Got me even more curious ğŸ¥¹

Not unlike lambda and J. Snow,
it feels like one knows nothing and less,
which has to mean something, right?

Studying topics are like
abstract substances with half-life of their own:
after a while TBD,
got to learn to detach to start dreaming again.

So many of them (John Conway)Â  ğŸ˜…

Hopefully, conferences will be recorded
so that one could have a glimpse at both of them later on.

Learning about data engineering would benefit
to many friends (self included) and
changing writing habits sounds like what I might need.

Related links:

^1 : Wikipedia article entitled Linguistic relativity

Tags:

  • #attending
    • #conference
  • #conway
  • #writing
